reviews.text: There was a problem with hot water in our shower. When the maintenance person arrived to address it, they were fairly rude. Won't go back.
reviews.title: Rude Service

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel over the long weekend in September. Firstly the parking is extremely limited, some underground, the rest is on the street or in a parking lot across the street. Be very careful with that parking lot on Sunday morning if your car is not gone by 8:30 am they tow the cars (oddly enough the hotel didn't warn us about this, luckily another person parking there pointed out the sign at the back of the lot). We did see a tow truck there Sunday morning waiting to tow anyone who didn't move their car.
reviews.title: Not what was expected

reviews.text: We got a room that was quite a bit smaller than what we were expecting and a smaller bed. The woman at the check in pointed out that we book at a "discount website" said in a tone that seemed to indicate it was a "lower" form of booking and we can't expect to get what we "request". We pointed out that on the site, we paid for that type of room but she said we didn't and even though our email said King we got a Queen bed.
reviews.title: Stayed many times, consistently good

reviews.text: We have never had this happen at any hotel and we always us Expedia and other sites to get a deal on the rooms.
reviews.title: Security is not their priority, vehicle broken into

reviews.text: Other than that the hotel was clean...nicely situated to see Parliament Hill and other touristy type things. The area of the hotel empties out early, not much night life. You need to walk several blocks to the active bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: we had a mouse in the room!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night for business in February. I stayed here during Winterlude so all the hotels were really expensive. I booked this hotel through priceline and I still thought I didn't get my money's worth.
reviews.title: Nothing Special but got a good deal

reviews.text: Pros: The hotel staff are extremely friendly and will do whatever it takes to make you happy. They are extremely accomodating and made my stay better than it actually was. There was also free internet and the hotel was quiet during my stay which I needed. There was a fridge in my room which was very convenient.
reviews.title: Dog Friendly!

reviews.text: Cons: The hotel looks a little run down in the lobby and in the rooms. The sleeper beds were not working and made my stay very uncomfortable. I have stayed at a radisson a few times and I've never had this problem. The lighting in the room was poor, the condition of the room and the washroom were not great, parking was really expensive and they still have the old box TVs.
reviews.title: good place for short stay

reviews.text: In all I think this is a 2.5 star hotel at most and in the future I think I'm going to paying a little more to stay in a better hotel at a more convenient location.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Radisson Parliament Hill on a weekend. Price was reasonable 119.00. Parking was 18.00 but there is plenty of free parking around the hotel on weekends. It seems like a safe area to park your car.
reviews.title: Priced right

reviews.text: I stayed here for 20 nights recently. Overall I would say that this is a very average hotel, and is not really suited to longer term business trips. After less than a week I was thoroughly sick of my room. The rooms are quite small and cramped. Not every room has a refrigerator, which seems odd. I asked for one and it was delivered almost instantly. It was noisy so I had to move it into the bathroom and eventually tinker with it to quieten it. No minibar either (probably a good thing). And no guest laundry.
reviews.title: OK but not really suitable for longer business trips

reviews.text: The free (wired) internet access was OK but I had to to reconfirm every night, and it would silently stop working after 24 hours until you restarted the browser and reconfirmed.
reviews.title: Great stay, great service!!

reviews.text: The room was clean enough on the surface but a telling point was that a candy wrapper left behind a bedside table by a previous guest remained there for the entire 20 days of my stay.
reviews.title: Beware - Party Hotel !

reviews.text: The room lighting (in common with most hotels) is terrible. Why there isn't a bright full-room lighting system so you can see what you're packing etc is beyond me. Dim lamps in corners, even when all turned on, do not help guests trying to round up clothing from various drawers and closets.
reviews.title: A fine value for downtown Ottawa

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is tired and the rooms are too small for a long term stay. I should have asked for a hotel with bigger rooms and - most importantly - a guest laundry. We really needed one and were amazed this property did not have one. The hotel staff were mostly excellent but knew nothing useful about laundromats nearby. The "gym" was pretty feeble and is not a selling point. The garage car spaces are incredibly narrow and every day we wondered whether our rental car would have scrape marks down the side from other guests' vehicles.
reviews.title: Comfortable but tired

reviews.text: I spend two nights in this hotel with my family. The room was outdated, a bit smelly, with noisy fan and definitely not clean as you should expect for the price of $120/night. I was not happy with very tight and expensive parking, too.
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.text: Their Internet connection was unreliable and good enough only for basic web browsing.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: There is nothing, except the location, to deserve more than one star. Very bad in my opinion, even for someone with totally basic needs.
reviews.title: Clean and great price

reviews.text: Efficient, friendly front desk. Rooms are small, but mine had an in-room fridge. Limited number of cable TV stations (less than 45). Comfortable bed. Clean but showing it's age a bit. Restaurant attached to main floor is Mexican themed. This is the hotel farthest to the west of the downtown area, so you are not close to the main mall (Cornwall Centre) but you are close to the Canadian War Museum, which I highly recommend. One complaint - drink machines on several floors were out of diet pepsi, one didn't work at all.
reviews.title: Nice and clean - but not Radisson US standards

reviews.text: Stayed there for one night. Nothin fancy but it was clean and the bed good at an excellent price. I parked on a nearby street for free as it was the weekend. Fish tacos in the restaurant were good!
reviews.title: Stay here only if you have to
